entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: sebastian_riedel
entries.text: A new major release of the "real-time web framework". It's smaller, has better test coverage, and can handle higher request rates.
entries.title: Mojolicious 7.0 released

entries.author: jason_crome
entries.text: A new version of Dancer2 has been released, David Golden has stepped down from the core team, and Peter Mottram has joined the core team.
entries.title: Dancer 2 0.201000 Released

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Sawyer's weekly round-up of the P5P mailing list.
entries.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: July 13th-22nd

entries.author: steve_hay
entries.text: The July development release of Perl 5, Perl 5.25.3, is now available.
entries.title: Perl 5.25.3 is now available

entries.author: navrup_johal
entries.text: A summary of some of the points made in a recent ActiveState webinar about the state of Perl, by Tom Radcliffe and Jason McIntosh.
entries.title: What's up Perl?

entries.text: A roundup of Perl 6 news, the headline of which was that Zoffix has been made a core member of the Rakudo project.
entries.title: Perl 6 Weekly - The Zoffix Has Landed

entries.author: jonathan_worthington
entries.text: He describes it as a shorter post, but but the time he's walked us through the 10 bugs he fixed (in one day!), it's not so short.
entries.title: Assorted fixes

entries.author: zoffix_znet
entries.text: Zoffix announces the July release of the Rakudo compiler for Perl 6.
entries.title: Rakudo Star Perl 6 Compiler Distribution Release 2016.07

entries.author: pawel_murias
entries.text: An updated on the work for a Javascript backend for Perl 6.
entries.title: Adding profiling support to nqp-js

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: How to compare complex data structures in your test cases, using the is_deeply function from Test::More.
entries.title: Comparing complex data-structures using is_deeply

entries.author: peter_sergeant
entries.text: Pete looks at basic test assertions in Perl, Ruby, and Python. This is the first in a series of articles.
entries.title: Perl, Python, and Ruby: The anatomy of a testing assertion

entries.author: gianluca_casati
entries.text: A short post on how to look-up the ISP for an IP address, using data from MaxMind.
entries.title: Compute ISP with Maxmind

entries.text: File this wherever you file stuff about TIOBE.
entries.title: Perl second-highest paying programming language?

entries.text: You may have heard of Smalltalk, but like me maybe you don't know a lot more than that. This short post summarises some of the things that we take for granted, which came to us from Smalltalk and its culture.
entries.title: How learning Smalltalk can make you a better developer

entries.text: One-to-one meetings are a key tool in the manager's toolbox. This is a good short post on how to kick those off with a new direct report.
entries.title: Questions for our first 1:1

header:
A lot of things got released this last week: a new major release of Mojolicious,
Dancer 2, Perl 5.25.3, and release candidates for two stable versions of Perl 5!

Everywhere I went I saw people playing Pokémon Go this last week.
It may be "just a game", but it's getting lots of people out and about,
and getting lots of people talking to each other,
both of which are a Good Thing.
subject: Gotta catch 'em all!
